li.a: Wellness Information for Staff and Community

a.title: Permanent Link to Welcome to Windsor C-1 School District!

h2.a: Welcome to Windsor C-1 School District!

p.span: Windsor C-1 School District is located in northern Jefferson County about 25 miles south of St. Louis, Missouri. The area associated with Windsor includes the towns of Kimmswick, Imperial, Barnhart, and Arnold, Missouri. The district currently has an enrollment of over 3000 students attending the five school buildings located in the district.

li.span: James E. Freer Elementary with grades ranging from pre-kindergarten through second grade.
Windsor Elementary houses kindergarten through second grade students.
Windsor Intermediate Center accommodates the third through fifth grade students from both Windsor Elementary and Freer Elementary.
Windsor Middle School teaches grades sixth through eighth.
Windsor Senior High School contains students ranging from freshmen (ninth grade) to seniors (twelfth grade).

div.a: Windsor C-1 School District was named a Missouri District of Character in 2018!
James E. Freer Elementary was named a National Blue Ribbon School in 2016!
Windsor Elementary School was named a National School of Character in 2018!
Windsor Middle School's student council was recognized as a 2016 Honor Council from the Missouri Association of Student Councils!
Windsor High School was named a National School of Character in 2015!
Windsor High School's student council was recognized as a 2018 National Gold Council of Excellence by the National Association of Student Councils! Fifth Consecutive Year!
Windsor High School was recognized in 2017 with the Promising Practice award by Character.org for its OWLS Academy transitional program for incoming freshmen.
The Windsor C-1 School District was named one of the St. Louis Post Dispatch's Top Work Places of 2018 for Midsize Companies. Third Consecutive Year!

p.strong: Windsor C-1 School District will remain closed through the rest of the 2019-2020 school year.

li.p: School services will continue through the week of May 18-22, 2020.
For more information please read the most recent letter from our superintendent, Dr. Joel Holland.
